query: Gravel Worlds Amateur gravel race Lincoln

videos.title: 2018 Gravel Worlds - 150 Miles of Heat, Hills & Gravel - Lincoln, Nebraska
videos.description:
"Pirate Cycling League brings you the unparalleled grassroots gravel race. The 2018 Gravel Worlds promises a unique challenge for the gravel enthusiast. The pirates are charting a route of approximately 150 miles and near 10,000 ft of climbing – adventuring through the rural farmlands of Southeastern Nebraska." - Pirate Cycling League

This video is from the perspective of JOM of the Gravel Cyclist crew. Most of the year, he resides in North Central Florida, not exactly renown for its hills!

Gravel Worlds  - http://www.gravel-worlds.com

JOM's Gravel Worlds Race Report - https://wp.me/p4V4se-6D8

Jim's Poetic Gravel Worlds Masterpiece - https://www.facebook.com/onyourback/videos/10156691126669777/

Cover photo by mccolganphoto.com/

Amazon Affiliation Link:
No cost to you, but every purchase made helps keep Gravel Cyclist up and running! - https://www.amazon.com/?&_encoding=UTF8&tag=gravelcyclist-20&linkCode=ur2&linkId=6b862b6af640d29360e2af2a5f17ddc6&camp=1789&creative=9325

Web: http://GravelCyclist.com
Facebook: http://facebook.com/GravelCyclist
Instagram - http://Instagram/GravelCyclist
Twitter - http://twitter.com/GravelCyclist
Vimeo - http://vimeo.com/GravelCyclist

Music credit (one of the tunes) - "Whatdafunk" - by audionautix.com
videos.transcript:
[Music]
this is the outskirts of Lincoln
Nebraska home to cornfields hills heat
and the unofficial world championships
of gravel gravel worlds if someone says
to you oh isn't Nebraska flat well that
would be a big negative because the
entire 150 mile course has about 11,000
feet of climbing
it's very lumpy indeed it's six o'clock
on Saturday morning central USA time and
we're about to embark on a 150 mile
adventure we start off on the neutral
but the pace isn't that neutral holding
somewhere around 25 miles an hour or 40
kilometers an hour if you're metric like
me
and here we go on to the first of many
gravel roads in these scenes I'm on the
tail end of the front bunch but it
didn't take long for their rapido pace
to greatly displeased my legs and I was
out the back and chugging along all
alone but the good news is I rode some
of the early miles with Christy mone one
of the promoters of the dirty cans of
gravel race Christy nos swap turns until
she dropped me somewhere along one of
their many hills of this course
incidentally I understand there were 87
hills along B for 150 mile or 240
kilometer course that's a wee bit
unpleasant when you make your home in
North Central Florida for most of the
year which isn't renowned being all that
hilly but there are plenty of down hills
to peddle flat-out
so it's sort of equalizers the roads are
in primo shape for much of the course
but there are many sections of the
gravel which put some riders into
difficulty you need to be very relaxed
and allow the bike to float especially
if you start slipping and sliding around
in the deep gravel or any kind of
sketchy Road for that matter
in addition to open roads and skies the
gravel world's course features plenty of
long and straight roads that can wreak
cutter havoc if the wind is blowing a
gale on race day the winds were almost
non-existent which is rare for this part
of the world this is the small town of
TUI home to the first oasis along the
course i refueled here with gatorade
which is known to mess my Stein so if
you want to read more of my gory details
behind this race check out my racer port
which is linked below the video for
those who aren't aware like most couple
races gravel world's requires riders to
be a source efficient that means no
outside support from friends or family
you have to carry your own food and
hydration with options to refuel along
the course at the two official
checkpoints Oasis or convenience stores
this is the town of Roma and on the
right is the alignment tavern for those
wondering about the wheelset
I'm writing it happens to be the Zenta
Scapa to 650b
carbon four-spoke will set I have a
review coming soon
one of the rare times our companions
during the race in this shot is Nick
Regan the author of the book gravel
cycling
next town on the menu is Valparaiso and
this is Valparaiso from the air
this is one of two mandatory checkpoints
and where I ran into Jim Phillips the
bard of gravel cycling to see the rest
of his gravel world's masterpiece look
for it in the link below this video
after the checkpoint arrived with this
group of lads on and off working
together as best we could
here I'm pulling into another Oasis and
I ran into Jim knocking out yet another
verse of his poem for the next leg Jim
and I rode together on and off meeting
again in the town of Malcolm Nebraska
we spent a bit of time hanging out front
of the Malcolm general store after
buying supplies
this is Malcolm from above note that the
main road through town is dirt and
gravel the anchors aren't bored in the
tables are stored I'm getting tired a
lot after Malcolm I wrote on and off
with Jim and Megan otherwise known as
the cyclists lawyer megan is a badass
single speed rider who ultimately took
second in the woman's a single speed
category on the right is the world's
largest covered wagon but admittedly it
is a little bit underwhelming time for
another stall stop 101 miles into the
course noticed a huge pile of empty
bottles from cyclists in the trash can
about 27 miles while 43 kilometers
remained until the next checkpoint this
was a tough section of course close to
the town of Denton Nebraska
sadly I did not film the dental wall
which is likely the steepest hill along
the entire course and here we have
Denton Nebraska
more chunky loose gravel and finally
checkpoint number two
just twenty two miles or about 35
kilometers left to ride in this scene
five miles to go this was a long hot
tough day in the saddle the hills have
done a serious number on my legs
the final sector of gravel back onto
pavement and back to the start/finish
line in Fallbrook an area of Lincoln
Nebraska nearing the finish line my time
wasn't super fast but I was happy to
finish especially considering how I felt
in the final three hours of this race
Korey the tall that on the left is one
of the founders of the gravel world's
race
thank you for watching if you haven't
already please subscribe to the gravel
cyclist YouTube channel I'll see you in
the next video

videos.title: 2016 Gravel Worlds: 145+ Miles in Lincoln, Nebraska! Available in 60FPS HD!
videos.description:
Saturday, August 20, 2016. JOM, K-Dogg and Mrs K-Dogg of the Gravel Cyclist crew flew 2 x steel Ritchey Breakaways and 1 x titanium Ritchey Breakaway along with tools, clothing, food and other stuff - to race 145+ miles and over 7,500 feet of climbing at the unofficial World Championships of Gravel - Gravel Worlds in Lincoln, Nebraska! Lincoln, Nebraska ain't flat...

JOM's race report: http://wp.me/p4V4se-39z
JOM's Ritchey Titanium Breakaway CX race bike: http://wp.me/p4V4se-389

Gravel Worlds website: http://gravel-worlds.com

Web: http://GravelCyclist.com
Facebook: http://facebook.com/GravelCyclist
Instagram - http://Instagram/GravelCyclist
Twitter - http://twitter.com/GravelCyclist
Vimeo - http://vimeo.com/GravelCyclist

videos.title: 2025 Lauf Gravel Worlds 150 Professional Race Livestream Presented by MGrills
videos.description:
Join us for the 2025 Lauf Gravel Worlds Livestream on Saturday, August 23rd at 5:45am CT.

We are celebrating 16 years! The 2025 Lauf Gravel Worlds® promises an unparalleled challenge for the gravel enthusiast. We are charting a route of approximately 150 miles and over 10,000+ ft of climbing – adventuring through the rural farmlands of Southeastern Nebraska.

videos.title: MN Grey Ducks Ride the 2025 Gravel Worlds, 75 Mile Gravel Race - Lincoln, Nebraska
videos.description:
Minnesota Grey Ducks are riding the 2025 - Gravel Worlds 75 mile gravel race in Lincoln, Nebraska.  This is an epic ride that the four of us participated in for the first time.  

SUBSCRIBE TO MY CHANNEL:     / @scottbauman  

This is the bikes I ride: 
        Fezzari (Now Ari) 2023 Shafer Elite gravel bike
        Jamis Komodo (2024) MTB
        Norco Bigfoot 2 (2022) fatbike

Camera gear: 
       Sony RX100vii
       GoPro 11
       Potensic Atom 2 (drone)

Welcome to Bauman Adventures This channel is dedicated to bringing awareness to all viewers that this world is a beautiful place with so much to see and even an old guy like me can pack up a bike and do some pretty amazing things!

Questions:
email: sabauman64 AT gmail.com

videos.title: Gravel Worlds 2025: Corn, Mud & a $100,000 Showdown in Nebraska
videos.description:
$100,000 on the line. Gravel, mud, and some of the toughest athletes in the country.

Welcome to Gravel Worlds 2025 in Lincoln, Nebraska!

This year’s event featured:
🚴 A 150 mile gravel race through iconic cornfields
🌽 Behind-the-scenes looks at the people, places and pure chaos of race day
💰 A massive $100,000 prize purse up for grabs

💪 And a bold new gravel triathlon addition

From muddy backroads to high speed sprints, this race recap takes you deep into the heart of American Gravel Racing. Whether you're here for the racing or the vibes, this one’s worth the watch.

📍 Location: Gravel Worlds – Lincoln, Nebraska
🎥 Shot by: Kerry Werner & Vince Camiolo / Bikeflights
🎶 Music: Rise Records

🔥 Like, comment and subscribe for more coverage from the world of gravel racing!
